SpeechRecognition.summary: The SpeechRecognition interface of the Web Speech API is the controller interface for the recognition service; this also handles the sent from the recognition service.

blockquote.para: On some browsers, like Chrome, using Speech Recognition on a web page involves a server-based recognition engine. Your audio is sent to a web service for recognition processing, so it won't work offline.

SpeechRecognitionAbort.summary:
The abort() method of the Web Speech API stops the speech
recognition service from listening to incoming audio, and doesn't attempt to return a
.

SpeechRecognitionAudioend.summary: The audioend event of the Web Speech API is fired when the user agent has finished capturing audio for speech recognition.

SpeechRecognitionAudiostart.summary: The audiostart event of the Web Speech API is fired when the user agent has started to capture audio for speech recognition.

SpeechRecognitionAvailable.summary: NOTE Experimental The available() static method of the Web Speech API checks whether the specified languages are available for speech recognition.

remarks.para: To install a language pack for speech recognition locally, use the method.

Access to the available() method is controlled by the Permissions-Policy/on-device-speech-recognition Permissions-Policy. Specifically, where a defined policy blocks usage, any attempts to call the method will fail.

-Web Speech API
-Using the Web Speech API
-
-

SpeechRecognitionAvailable.returns: A that resolves with an enumerated value indicating the availability of the specified languages for speech recognition.Possible values include:

SpeechRecognitionContinuous.summary:
The continuous property of the
interface controls whether continuous results are
returned for each recognition, or only a single result.
SpeechRecognitionContinuous.value:
A boolean value representing the current SpeechRecognition's
continuous status. true means continuous, and false means not
continuous (single result each time.)

SpeechRecognitionEnd.summary: The end event of the Web Speech API object is fired when the speech recognition service has disconnected.

SpeechRecognitionError.summary: The error event of the Web Speech API object is fired when a speech recognition error occurs.

SpeechRecognitionGrammars.summary:
The grammars property of the
interface returns and sets a collection of
objects that represent the grammars that will be understood
by the current SpeechRecognition.

blockquote.para: The concept of grammar has been removed from the Web Speech API. Related features remain in the specification and are still recognized by supporting browsers for backwards compatibility, but they have no effect on speech recognition services.

SpeechRecognitionGrammars.value: A containing the objects that represent the grammars used by your app.

SpeechRecognitionInstall.summary: NOTE Experimental The install() static method of the Web Speech API installs the required language packs for on-device speech recognition in the specified languages.

remarks.para: To check if the language packs are already available, use the method.

Access to the install() method is controlled by the Permissions-Policy/on-device-speech-recognition Permissions-Policy directive. Specifically, where a defined policy blocks usage, any attempts to call the method will fail.

-Web Speech API
-Using the Web Speech API
-
-

SpeechRecognitionInstall.returns: A that resolves with a boolean value indicating whether the language pack was installed successfully. The conditions that result in each return value are as follows:

SpeechRecognitionInterimResults.summary:
The interimResults property of the
interface controls whether interim results should be
returned (true) or not (false). Interim results are results
that are not yet final (e.g., the property
is false).

remarks.para: The default value for interimResults is false.

SpeechRecognitionInterimResults.value:
A boolean value representing the state of the current
SpeechRecognition's interim results. true means interim
results are returned, and false means they aren't.

SpeechRecognitionLang.summary:
The lang property of the
interface returns and sets the language of the current SpeechRecognition.
If not specified, this defaults to the HTML lang attribute
value, or the user agent's language setting if that isn't set either.
SpeechRecognitionLang.value: A string representing the language for the current SpeechRecognition. The value should be a valid BCP 47 language tag.

SpeechRecognitionMaxAlternatives.summary:
The maxAlternatives property of the
interface sets the maximum number of
s provided per
.
SpeechRecognitionMaxAlternatives.value: A number representing the maximum returned alternatives for each result.

SpeechRecognitionNomatch.summary: The nomatch event of the Web Speech API is fired when the speech recognition service returns a final result with no significant recognition.

remarks.para: This may involve some degree of recognition, which doesn't meet or exceed the threshold.

SpeechRecognitionPhrases.summary:
NOTE Experimental The phrases property of the
interface sets an array of objects to be used for contextual biasing.

SpeechRecognitionProcessLocally.summary:
NOTE Experimental The processLocally property of the
interface specifies whether speech recognition must be performed locally on the user's device.

remarks.para: See On-device speech recognition for more information.

SpeechRecognitionResult.summary: The result event of the Web Speech API is fired when the speech recognition service returns a result — a word or phrase has been positively recognized and this has been communicated back to the app

SpeechRecognitionSoundend.summary: The soundend event of the Web Speech API is fired when any sound — recognizable speech or not — has stopped being detected.

SpeechRecognitionSoundstart.summary: The soundstart event of the Web Speech API is fired when any sound — recognizable speech or not — has been detected.

SpeechRecognitionSpeechend.summary: The speechend event of the Web Speech API is fired when speech recognized by the speech recognition service has stopped being detected.

SpeechRecognitionSpeechRecognition.summary:
The SpeechRecognition() constructor creates a new
object instance.

SpeechRecognitionSpeechstart.summary: The speechstart event of the Web Speech API is fired when sound recognized by the speech recognition service as speech has been detected.

SpeechRecognitionStart.summary: The start() method of the Web Speech API starts the speech recognition service to listen for incoming audio (from a microphone or an audio track) and returns the results of that recognition.

The start event of the Web Speech API object is fired when the speech recognition service has begun listening to incoming audio with intent to recognize grammars associated with the current SpeechRecognition.

SpeechRecognitionStop.summary: The stop() method of the Web Speech API stops the speech recognition service from listening for incoming audio and attempts to return a based on the results captured so far.
